p:
The original time series of the incidence of infectious diarrhea was stationary (Dickey−Fuller = −4.26, P < 0.01). Univariate ARIMA models were developed. The best-fitting ARIMA model was determined to be ARIMA (1,0,1)(1,0,0) 52, with a minimum AIC = − 575.92 and a minimum BIC = − 558.14. The Ljung−Box test results suggested that the residual series of the model was a white noise sequence ( χ
2 = 0.01, P = 0.93).
